intro: Conostylis dielsii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Conostylis dielsii is adapted to withstand arid conditions and is an important component of native grassland ecosystems.
